title: Brownian and fractional polymers with self-repulsion
authors: Samuel Eleut\'erio and R. Vilela Mendes
abstract:
Brownian and fractional processes are useful computational tools for the
modelling of physical phenomena. Here, modelling linear homopolymers in
solution as Brownian or fractional processes, we develop a formalism to take
into account both the interactions of the polymer with the solvent as well as
the effect of arbitrary polymer-polymer potentials and Gibbs factors. As an
example the average squared length is computed for a non-trivial Gaussian Gibbs
factor, which is also compared with the Edwards' and a step factor.
